page.title: 01GARGRAVE.
page.content: In the valley of the{River Aire}which flows through the village from West to East, with{Sharphaw}1171 ft. to the NE and{Scaleber}550 ft. to the SW, { {Gargrave}is between 350 and 400 ft. above sea level. On the Southern edge of the{Yorkshire {Dales National Park,}Gargrave is not a typical Dales village, but an attractive village which would be at home in almost any county. The three{village greens}are not common land, but belong to the village, giving residents fishing rights from them There has been a settlement of some kind here from very early times. The remains of a{Roman Villa}lie buried at {Kirk Sink}to the SE of the village.
